column1: {'title': 'Data Science & Visualization Enginee', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/14524845', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/webologix', 'companyId': '14524845', 'companyUniversalName': 'webologix', 'companyName': 'Webologix Ltd/ INC', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 11, 'formattedLocation': 'Cupertino, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Staffing and Recruiting, IT Services and IT Consulting', 'jobDescription': 'Job Title: Data Science & Visualization EngineerLocations: Cupertino, CAType of hire: Fulltime \nSkill Required: Python | Tableau| iOS\nJob Description:Minimum 6+ years of experience working as a Data EngineerExperience building data pipelines with Python and RWillingness to learn new technologies and implement POCs in short timeSupport SQL and python production jobsExperience in data visualization using TableauExperience in Swift, iOS appsAbility to follow triage playbook and contribute as new scenarios ariseExperience in writing and optimizing complex SQL queriesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent multi-tasking and organizational skillsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills', 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'IT', 'companyApplyUrl': '', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3974366250/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:47:48.000Z'}

{'title': 'Data Annotation Manager', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/99112759', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/essentialai', 'companyId': '99112759', 'companyUniversalName': 'essentialai', 'companyName': 'Essential AI', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 54, 'formattedLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development, Engineering Services', 'jobDescription': 'Essential AI’s mission is to deepen the partnership between humans and computers, unlocking collaborative capabilities that far exceed what could be achieved today. We believe that building delightful end-user experiences requires innovating across the stack - from the UX all the way down to models that achieve the best user value per FLOP.
We believe that a small, focused team of motivated individuals can create outsized breakthroughs. We are building a world-class multi-disciplinary team who are excited to solve hard real-world AI problems. We are well-capitalized and supported by March Capital and Thrive Capital, with participation from AMD, Franklin Venture Partners, Google, KB Investment, NVIDIA.
The RoleThe Data Annotation Manager will be responsible for curating mission-critical annotated data for Essential’s machine learning models. You will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure collection of high-quality annotated data that drives the improvements in capabilities and performance of our models. This is a critical role that requires strong analytical skills, an eye for detail, and the ability to work efficiently and accurately.
What you’ll be working onStrategically partner with cross-functional stakeholders to understand end-user objectives and requirements and translate that into specifications for data annotation.Layout a roadmap for annotation timelines, including feedback on what’s realistic and what’s aspirational.Develop an annotation program to meet our capability requirements, including but not limited to clear instructions to a team of annotators, identify where the gaps in the instructions may be, and perform quality checks on annotated data to ensure accuracy and consistency, making necessary corrections and improvements.Meet deadlines and productivity targets while maintaining high accuracy rates.Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation in data annotation workflows to increase productivity and quality.
What we are looking forExperience in data annotation or related roles, with a strong understanding of annotation techniques and best practices.Familiarity with annotation tools/software. Bonus if you have built and designed custom annotation tools.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an eye for detail.Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.Experience with text (structured and unstructured), image, audio, and/or video data annotation.Knowledge of machine learning concepts and workflows is desirable but not required.Deeply wants to understand the task, capabilities of the model, and success criteria of the task, partnering closely with the Applied ML team to understand end-user needs.Should be able to take a higher-level description of the dataset and convert that into specific requirements. For example, connecting the task requirements to iterate on the annotator interface and interaction mechanism.Previous experience building or leading a data annotation team.
We encourage you to apply for this position even if you don’t meet all of the above requirements but want to work on these techniques.We are based in-person in SF and fully onsite 5 days a week. We offer relocation assistance to new employees.
The base pay range target for the role seniority described in this job description is $175,000 - $220,000 in San Francisco, CA. Final offer amounts depend on multiple factors such as candidate experience and expertise, geographic location, total compensation, and market data. In addition to base pay, full-time regular positions are eligible for equity, 401(k), and healthcare benefits.', 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'ENG, PRJM, STRA', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/essentialai/09c2d8f6-9610-4609-8178-67a2fe44c9b8', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3967790165/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-09T20:41:04.000Z'}

{'title': 'Business Consultant (PR-1284671:CA)', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/78102861', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/pareto-usa', 'companyId': '78102861', 'companyUniversalName': 'pareto-usa', 'companyName': 'Pareto USA', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 7, 'formattedLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Entry level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Airlines and Aviation', 'jobDescription': "Compensation and Perks
Basic salary of $60,000Y1 commission taking your total earnings to $90k!A multi-award-winning, inclusive, highly social cultureMedical, vision and dental contributionsLaptop and cellFantastic opportunities to progress within the business401(k) contributions
The Role at a Glance:
As a Business Consultant, you’ll provide clients with solutions. Our client requires someone with confident communication skills to apply their knowledge to a consultancy role. You'll use strong communication and collaboration skills along with multiple methods of outreach to speak with high level executives.
Within this role will be responsible for lead generation, cold calling and prospecting potential customers in a fast-paced environment.
Who Our Client Is:
An innovative, dynamic tech/telecoms company is on the lookout for ambitious college graduates to join their team as Business Consultants. This multi-award-winning company boasts a lively atmosphere in a sought-after, central location. With offices across the globe, there are myriad opportunities for progression both across the US and around the world!
Who You Are:An ambitious recent college graduate who is an intelligent, well-spoken self-starter. You have an exceptional work ethic and drive to succeed. You possess exceptional communication and interpersonal skills that you’ll use to expand our clients’ presence in the market.
Requirements:
A 4-year bachelor’s degreePossess exceptional communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to work within a team and independently
Pareto is committed to promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We encourage and welcome applications from all, irrespective of background or circumstance. Our consultants are happy to discuss any adjustments you require in support of your application.", 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'SALE, BD', 'companyApplyUrl': '', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3974359256/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:33:17.000Z'}
column4:
{'title': 'Senior Data Scientist, Alexa Audio Data and Insights', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1586', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/amazon', 'companyId': '1586', 'companyUniversalName': 'amazon', 'companyName': 'Amazon', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 56, 'formattedLocation': 'Sunnyvale, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': "Description

Office locations include: Seattle WA, Bellevue WA, and Sunnyvale CA.

Amazon’s Alexa is a cloud-based voice service that powers Amazon’s groundbreaking voice-powered devices. These devices are part of Amazon’s vision to build a computer in the cloud that is completely controlled by your voice. Alexa Music is a critical Alexa domain, focused on delivering magical music experiences that drive adoption and engagement with Alexa.

The Alexa Audio Data and Insight (AUDI) team consists of talented Data Scientists, Business Intelligence Engineers, and Data Engineers. We seek an experienced Senior Data Scientist to drive Alexa Music customer engagement. You are the data science lead to define the ambiguous space. We are looking for a thought leader and you demonstrate this by delivering solutions, not just by having ideas. We encourage you to shape the business strategy with data driven recommendations. A successful candidate has an entrepreneurial spirit and wants to make a big impact on Alexa Music customers. You will develop strong working relationships and thrive in a collaborative team environment. Your role requires the ability to influence a team of contributors and interact with marketing executives. You draw from a broad data science expertise to mentor Scientists and Business Intelligence Engineers; following a rigorous scientific methodology, while providing leadership on complex technology issues. You provide guidance on cutting-edge methods in big data processing, data science literature, experimentation and careful consideration of modeling decisions. We expect you to have breadth of data science knowledge, familiar with casual inference and depth in predictive modeling (supervised learning) and A/B testing. In particular, this role would need in depth understanding and industry experience working with large datasets and building recommendation systems.

Problems we are solving include: 1) what music features should we proactively recommend to customers? 2) how should we prioritize content vs feature recommendations for the customers?

Responsibilities

 Build/Develop/Apply existing models to support feature recommendations for customers Drive scientific best practices across teams mentoring others based on learnings gained through Alexa Audio's initiatives Proactively seek to identify business opportunities and provide solutions based on a broad and deep knowledge of Amazon’s data resources, industry best-practices, and work done by other teams. Partner with, coordinate, and influence multiple teams outside of Alexa Audio (Alexa Finance, Alexa Experience Data, Amazon Music, etc.), to support key initiatives. Be the voice of the customer (end customer and data consumer), aligning stakeholders with scalable mechanisms to incorporate our models into product and engineering decision-making processes

A day in the life

When We Work Together, We Operate

 Centralize the sprint and consolidate to one queue but still give stakeholder visibility and continue to ask feedback; Advocate knowledge sharing and code review; Avoid single point of failure with a secondary owner as code reviewer, mentor, backup, etc; Consolidate across org initiatives to the same primary owner; Train everyone on the must-have knowledges; Carve out time for high-sev tt, urgent requests, tech debt failure; Favor problem statement other than data requests

About The Team

We are a team made up of Business Intelligence Engineers (BIEs), Data Engineers (DEs), and Data Scientists (DS’s), who bring with deep experience in both business analytics and data science. We cover the data needs of Music, Radio, Podcast, Books, and the Audio Category.

Basic Qualifications

 7+ years of data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab, etc.) experience 5+ years of data scientist experience Experience with statistical models e.g. multinomial logistic regression

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience as a leader and mentor on a data science team

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $127,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $247,600/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2608964", 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'ENG, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://www.amazon.jobs/jobs/2608964/senior-data-scientist-alexa-audio-data-and-insights?cmpid=SPLICX0248M&utm_source=linkedin.com&utm_campaign=cxro&utm_medium=social_media&utm_content=job_posting&ss=paid', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3909011752/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-06-22T15:41:25.000Z'}
column5:
{'title': 'Data Scientist, Mid with Security Clearance', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1007957', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/clearancejobs', 'companyId': '1007957', 'companyUniversalName': 'clearancejobs', 'companyName': 'ClearanceJobs', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': '', 'formattedLocation': 'San Diego, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Part-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Entry level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Defense and Space Manufacturing', 'jobDescription': "Job Number: R0201443 Data Scientist, Mid

The Opportunity: As a data scientist, you're excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you're fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, machine learning, and artifi cia l intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data scientist at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence, we need you to help find the answers in the data. On our team, you'll use your leadership skills and data science expertise to create real-world impact. You'll work closely with clients to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You'll guide teammates and lead the development of algorithms and systems. You'll use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to advise your clients as they make informed decisions. Ultimately, you'll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used. Work with us as we use data science for good. Join us. The world can't wait. You Have: * Experience with data science, data analytics, machine learning, or statistics

 Experience with object-oriented programming languages, including Python, C++, Java, or R Experience identifying and analyzing data sets to meet customer requirements Experience preparing customer data for models, including merging and aggregating data, handling anomalies, balancing, and feature selection Knowledge of Cloud services, including AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Ability to help interpret model results and communicate them clearly through compelling data visualizations Ability to obtain a security clearance * Bachelor's degree Nice If You Have: * Experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning te chn iques, including neural networks, decision trees, logistic regressions, or dimension reduction Experience with data engineering and data science tools, including Databricks, ElasticSearch, Apache NiFi, or StreamSets Experience with enterprise DataOps, DevSecOps, and MLOps processes to operationalize and monitor data science models Experience with Agile development Experience with CI / CD, including Git, Je nk ins, and Docker Knowledge of procedural SQL language, including PL / pgSQL Ability to explain analytic and model findings to non-te chn ical audiences Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information . Create Your Career: Grow With Us Your growth matters to us-that's why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs , tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms. A Place Where You Belong Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen's culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you'll develop your community in no time. Support Your Well-Being Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401 ( k ) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we'll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life-at work and at home. Your Candidate Journey At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we've compiled a list of resources so you'll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us. Compensation At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen's benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page. Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $75,600.00 to $172,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen's total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date. Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely. * If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you'll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.

 If this position is listed as onsite, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role. EEO Commitment We're an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change - no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.", 'inferredBenefits': '401(k), Tuition assistance', 'jobFunctions': 'ENG, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://click.appcast.io/track/k1ty10y?cs=i8d&jg=4nq9&bid=q948nGl57dNhZO5Va2AQmA==', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3973679188/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:30:35.000Z'}

{'title': 'Principal Customer Experience Specialist', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1666', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/intuit', 'companyId': '1666', 'companyUniversalName': 'intuit', 'companyName': 'Intuit', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': '', 'formattedLocation': 'Mountain View, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': "Overview

Come join the Small Business & Self-Employed Group (SBSEG) Customer Experience Growth & Retention team as a Principle Customer Experience Manager, responsible for designing the service experience for our existing and emerging Expert service offerings for our small business owners.

We are looking for a customer obsessed leader to create new experiences that will use the power of our ecosystem of products and expert-based services to drive growth for the business and add value to our customer experience. This leader will help identify and validate new expert-led experiences and help build new products, with a focus on creating ecosystem wide service experiences for customers and experts as we broadly expand our portfolio for Intuit expert services at large. You will partner with other functions including Marketing, Customer Success, Sales, Expert Network Platform, Product Management, PD, Design and Data to ensure we deliver the world-class experiences for our customers through deep customer insights and hypothesis-driven experimentation and innovation.

What you'll bring

 8-10 years of Customer Experience or Product Marketing experience, including leading in a highly matrixed, cross-functional and fast-moving environment, developing product/service experiences and driving revenue & customer growth Strong acumen in understanding customer behavior with experience in consumer segmentation and using design thinking and scientific methodologies to inform decision making; A/B testing experience is a mandatory Robust analytical and problem-solving skills with clear examples of using data actively for customer insights, measurement, ROI analysis and recommendations Customer champion with a design mindset and demonstrated strengths in product management or experience design (ideally with SaaS, Self-Help, or CRM environment). Have led the creation of online experiences (from concept through production) Customer Service & Support Expert: Demonstrated strength managing or working with customer support organizations and operations (direct or via BPO) Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Have the ability to roll-up sleeves and lead by example at both strategic and tactical levels BA/BS required or equivalent work experience, MBA strongly preferred

How you will lead

 Continuously build deep empathy and understanding of our customers and their struggles as they build and grow their business, and find innovative expert-led solutions to help solve their biggest needs. Design and define the service strategy for new experiences that help address SMBs biggest challenges while driving business growth. Deliver value to customers and experts with healthy economics, optimizing the labor model and increasing overall revenue for the business. Understand the pain points and needs of our experts to deliver a two-way experience that drives a great experience for the experts who deliver for our customers. Develop and use customer segmentation to deliver innovative and personalized service experiences, translating deep customer insights into innovative, bold strategies that deliver retention, customer growth and revenue growth. personalized service experiences, backed by data and in-depth research, leveraging AI/ ML driven targeted interventions. Partner with Product, Research, Design, Marketing, Finance and Data teams in a highly matrixed organization to innovate and A/B test new customer experiences and influence the product/service roadmap. Actively analyze business and test data to generate insights and make informed decisions that drive business results.", 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'OTHR', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://dsp.prng.co/bC7XSFb', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3974365090/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:56:24.000Z'}

{'title': 'Research Engineer (Crypto Protocol)', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/6849', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/dice', 'companyId': '6849', 'companyUniversalName': 'dice', 'companyName': 'Dice', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': '', 'formattedLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Entry level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': 'Series A, well-funded crypto infrastructure startup is looking for a high-level Research Engineer to join their growing team!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Sydney Weaver

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $165,000 - $350,000 per year

A bit about us:

Crypto startup is looking for a highly skilled Protocol Research Engineer to join their growing team! They are backed by a few top VC's and key players within the crypto space. In this role, you'll conduct research, architect protocols, and implement core infrastructure components that power their network. Their product will enable users to deploy their apps as their own customizable rollups, where they can pick (1) the base layer, (2) the virtual machine (EVM, SVM, Move), and (3) additional modifications for greater value accrual. This is a permanent position in a dynamic and exciting startup environment!

Responsibilities:

 Dive deep into the exploration of decentralized networks, exploring the mechanisms that achieve consensus, the principles of cryptography, and the intricacies of protocol development. Innovate and design groundbreaking protocols and algorithms aimed at overcoming the hurdles related to scalability, security, and efficiency within the cryptocurrency realm. Develop and enhance the core features and infrastructure of protocols using Rust, focusing on optimizing performance and reliability. Craft detailed technical documents, including whitepapers and research findings, to effectively communicate the advancements and designs of protocols to the broader community.

This role is perfect for someone passionate about leveraging technology to solve complex problems and eager to make a significant impact in the evolving cryptocurrency space.

Why join us?

They offer competitive compensation, benefits, and a stimulating work environment where your expertise will be highly valued and your ideas can make a significant impact!

 Great health benefits package, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match Remote work (local to USA) Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity  Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity.  Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company's product and as well as the industry at large.

Job Details

Qualifications:

 PhD or equivalent experience as a researcher at another notable protocol 2+ or more years of experience in crypto, with a focus on R&D  1+ or more years of experience minimum working with Rust programming language BS in CS or related; Master's or PhD in cryptography or similar is a plus Experience working at a crypto native startup, preferably blockchain infrastructure Prior contributions to protocol design and implementation Background and strong understanding of decentralized networks, consensus mechanisms, cryptographic primitives, and protocol-level concepts Ability to work independently and as part of a team Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Strong communication and collaboration skills

If you are passionate about blockchain technology and have a proven track record of building and maintaining blockchain infrastructure, we want to hear from you. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing startup and make a significant impact on the future of blockchain technology.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Research Engineer (Crypto Protocol)', 'inferredBenefits': '401(k)', 'jobFunctions': 'ENG, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://click.appcast.io/track/k1zisxk?cs=ivj&sjg=71nj', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3971173516/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:28:27.000Z'}

{'title': 'Incident Manager', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/6849', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/dice', 'companyId': '6849', 'companyUniversalName': 'dice', 'companyName': 'Dice', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 1, 'formattedLocation': 'Cupertino, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': 'Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, TEKsystems c/o Allegis Group, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Incident & Problem Manager

12 Month Contract (On-Going)

Pay Rate: $1 - $60/hr.

Hybrid 3 Days a Week in Cupertino

With strong collaborative skills, you will work on the Service Operations team alongside SREs, Developers, and business partners with the express goal of rapid incident resolution in the event of a service outage or degraded customer experience.

You will be expected to communicate the status of an incident, both internally and externally, influence technical specialists and organizational leaders, and be the single point of contact for the incident.

The Incident & Problem Coordinator must excel at situational appraisal, problem analysis, troubleshooting methodologies, and communications.

Key Qualifications:

 Experienced in major incident response and triaging problems related to critical services and infrastructure; exhibiting ownership in the investigation and resolution of incidents. Demonstrated excellence communicating effectively under pressure, including partner engagement and escalations, crafting high quality stakeholder updates; ensuring communications are timely and meaningful. Experienced as driver or leading contributor in post-incident review and root cause analysis; using five Whys and other methods to develop action items and lessons learned. Depth of knowledge and understanding of incident and problem management KPIs, metrics, and tooling; capturing critical incident data accurately and transforming those metrics into valuable operational and business insights. Proactive and curious; analysis of trends in incident and problem reports to assist in eliminating recurring incidents, surfacing problems before they become critical, and increasing overall efficiency. Multi-Language Proficiency in Mandarin, Japanese, English (applicable to APAC roles only)

Additional Tooling/Skills (helpful But Not Required)

Splunk log aggregation and analysis

Ticket tracking via ServiceNow, Jira, or similar

Data analysis and visualization using Excel, Numbers, Tableau or similar

Skills:

Incident management, Incident response, Problem management, ITIL, Root cause analysis

Additional Skills & Qualifications:

Company incident management practice is surprisingly immature, and a lot of processes are not documented. This person MUST be okay with that - looking for someone who can "go with the flow" and use some common sense to reach resolutions, and also have confidence in their ability to leverage that autonomy. This is VERY important.

Should be willing to roll up their sleeves and deal with lots of ambiguity, change, and do so enthusiastically.

Experience Level:

Expert Level

About TEKsystems:

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. Incident Manager', 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://click.appcast.io/track/k1zih1w?cs=ivj&sjg=6ijf', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3971176090/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:28:27.000Z'}
column10:
{'title': 'Lead ESG Analyst', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1666', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/intuit', 'companyId': '1666', 'companyUniversalName': 'intuit', 'companyName': 'Intuit', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': '', 'formattedLocation': 'Mountain View, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': "Overview

At Intuit, we are developing and delivering best-in-class environmental, social and governance (ESG) initiatives that elevate the company’s position as an industry ESG leader. As a member of the ESG Strategy and Reporting team within the Finance organization, the Lead ESG Analyst is a key contributor in the evolution and execution of that strategy.

Reporting to and partnering with the Director, ESG Strategy & Reporting, this newly-created position requires a professional who is knowledgeable about a broad range of ESG topics and capable of driving various initiatives within an organization, focused on two key areas: the communication of Intuit’s ESG plans, programs and progress; and, the design and deployment of new approaches to collecting data and disclosures.

This role will be instrumental in the execution of various ESG communication initiatives, including our annual Report and responses to surveys from ESG raters and rankers. You will collaborate with a cross functional team to curate and amplify our programs and progress in these and other critical internal and external communications channels. In addition, this position will design and implement processes and internal controls to acquire and consolidate precise ESG data and performance metrics from various contributors across the organization in compliance with external assurance expectations and in preparation for evolving regulatory reporting standards.

The ideal candidate will be an excellent collaborator, with experience engaging various corporate functions and diverse stakeholders; a strategic thinker, highly organized and efficient with strong project management skills and have a zest for tracking changing regulations, trends and best-practices in this evolving field. As a courageous individual contributor, you are collaborative and able to work with, educate and influence stakeholders; you will foster relationships across the organization and liaise with leaders and subject experts responsible for ESG policies, strategy, and programs.

What you'll bring

Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in a quantitative field. Equivalent Experience will be considered3-5 years of experience in ESG reporting, sustainability or corporate social responsibility. Solid understanding of ESG reporting frameworks, such as GRI, SASB, and TCFD, and experience assessing and preparing ESG metrics.Experience working in a highly matrixed organization and collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels of the organization with the ability to influence others without formal reporting relationships.Familiar with and have prepared reporting to ESG surveys, ratings agencies and benchmarking organizations including S&P CSA, CDP, MSCI, Sustainalytics, ISS, JUST Capital, etc.Strong analytical skills and technical acumen.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, including experience presenting to internal and external stakeholders at all levels.Understanding of evolving regulatory requirements related to ESG reporting and experience engaging with various external stakeholders on ESG issues.Ability to think strategically, adapt to change, and develop long-term plans to achieve business and sustainability outcomes.Able to inspire trust, clarity, and consensus within a complex, fast-paced and changing environment.Strong project management and organizational skills. Proven track record of balancing multiple projects and opposing priorities. Acute attention to detail and maintaining a consistent awareness of timelines is needed for success.Experience with sustainability reporting software (i.e. Metrio, Watershed, etc.) a plus.Experience with the assurance of ESG disclosures a plus.

How you will lead

Contribute to and help execute a multi-year plan for building a best-in-class ESG strategy and reporting function at the company.Project manage and drive Intuit’s annual Corporate Responsibility report in close collaboration with Communications, Marketing, Corporate Responsibility, People & Places DEI team, Sustainability, Investor Relations, Audit and Legal.Facilitate the ESG data / disclosure strategy and processes. You will co-create and implement processes and internal controls to ensure proper data collection and governance; continuously assess and enhance the relevance, volume and quality of our disclosures; co-create and deliver training to numerous stakeholders; consolidate and analyze business unit data for company-wide ESG reporting.Build and nurture relationships with key internal and external stakeholders and respond to various requests for information from investors and other stakeholders regarding our ESG performance. Contribute to Intuit’s engagement with third-party ESG rating agencies, such as ISS, S&P CSA and MSCI among others, including the prioritization of rating entities and regularly monitoring our performance as measured by them.Project manage internal committees and working groups that focus on specific ESG matters, encouraging the continuous improvement of their approach, impact and outcomes. Align Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and teams towards a clearer vision of what ESG means and should mean for the company in the future. Stay up-to-date on regulatory changes (US SEC, California, CSRD, and/or ISSB) and industry trends related to ESG reporting, including mandatory reporting, communicate information to relevant stakeholders, and integrate new requirements into reporting processes, in collaboration with Legal, Finance, and other functions.Conduct research on industry best practices related to ESG reporting and continually benchmark against other companies’ reporting practices and integrate new findings into reporting processes.Be highly involved in the development and delivery of ESG collateral for diverse audiences (i.e.: executive engagement, board meetings, investor presentations, etc.).", 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'BD, SALE', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://dsp.prng.co/Q_4N8Cb', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3974359902/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:56:24.000Z'}
column11:
{'title': 'Principal Customer Experience Specialist', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1666', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/intuit', 'companyId': '1666', 'companyUniversalName': 'intuit', 'companyName': 'Intuit', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': '', 'formattedLocation': 'San Diego, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': "Overview

Come join the Small Business & Self-Employed Group (SBSEG) Customer Experience Growth & Retention team as a Principle Customer Experience Manager, responsible for designing the service experience for our existing and emerging Expert service offerings for our small business owners.

We are looking for a customer obsessed leader to create new experiences that will use the power of our ecosystem of products and expert-based services to drive growth for the business and add value to our customer experience. This leader will help identify and validate new expert-led experiences and help build new products, with a focus on creating ecosystem wide service experiences for customers and experts as we broadly expand our portfolio for Intuit expert services at large. You will partner with other functions including Marketing, Customer Success, Sales, Expert Network Platform, Product Management, PD, Design and Data to ensure we deliver the world-class experiences for our customers through deep customer insights and hypothesis-driven experimentation and innovation.

What you'll bring

 8-10 years of Customer Experience or Product Marketing experience, including leading in a highly matrixed, cross-functional and fast-moving environment, developing product/service experiences and driving revenue & customer growth Strong acumen in understanding customer behavior with experience in consumer segmentation and using design thinking and scientific methodologies to inform decision making; A/B testing experience is a mandatory Robust analytical and problem-solving skills with clear examples of using data actively for customer insights, measurement, ROI analysis and recommendations Customer champion with a design mindset and demonstrated strengths in product management or experience design (ideally with SaaS, Self-Help, or CRM environment). Have led the creation of online experiences (from concept through production) Customer Service & Support Expert: Demonstrated strength managing or working with customer support organizations and operations (direct or via BPO) Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Have the ability to roll-up sleeves and lead by example at both strategic and tactical levels BA/BS required or equivalent work experience, MBA strongly preferred

How you will lead

 Continuously build deep empathy and understanding of our customers and their struggles as they build and grow their business, and find innovative expert-led solutions to help solve their biggest needs. Design and define the service strategy for new experiences that help address SMBs biggest challenges while driving business growth. Deliver value to customers and experts with healthy economics, optimizing the labor model and increasing overall revenue for the business. Understand the pain points and needs of our experts to deliver a two-way experience that drives a great experience for the experts who deliver for our customers. Develop and use customer segmentation to deliver innovative and personalized service experiences, translating deep customer insights into innovative, bold strategies that deliver retention, customer growth and revenue growth. personalized service experiences, backed by data and in-depth research, leveraging AI/ ML driven targeted interventions. Partner with Product, Research, Design, Marketing, Finance and Data teams in a highly matrixed organization to innovate and A/B test new customer experiences and influence the product/service roadmap. Actively analyze business and test data to generate insights and make informed decisions that drive business results.", 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'OTHR', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://dsp.prng.co/Gjeqj8b', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3974359903/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:56:24.000Z'}

{'title': 'Service Technician', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/6088', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/appleone', 'companyId': '6088', 'companyUniversalName': 'appleone', 'companyName': 'AppleOne Employment Services', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 1, 'formattedLocation': 'Roseville, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Contract', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Associate', 'formattedIndustries': 'Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing', 'jobDescription': 'The Service Representative is responsible for providing the highest quality of customer support through the technical support telephone hotline. Duties include answering incoming calls to the service line and resolving all types of customer issues, providing assistance to installers in the field, providing technical training to internal personnel, creating tickets to dispatch to field service teams and providing support to other departments.
PRIMARY DUTIES
Maintains the technical support hotline, and uses communication skills to provide customer support to users, installers and customers.Creates documentation as needed for publication in document- and web-based media, describing common technical issues and solutions, and to create technical field reports.Provides technical training to internal personnel on the technical aspects of product lines, and develops training materials.Provides support to the Sales and Marketing departments by serving as a product generalist, and building familiarity with competitors’ products.Other duties as may be required or assigned.
RELEVANT EXPERIENCE
A technical associate degree or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.A four-year degree in Engineering or Technology-related field is preferred.Exposure/experience in the design, implementation and/or technical support of complex electro-mechanical systems.Experience in renewable energy is preferred but not required.
OTHER SPECIALIZED SKILLS
Knowledge of basic electrical theory or networking technology is required.Customer focus and a service-oriented attitude are required.Ability to communicate on the phone with customers while taking detailed notes is required.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite is required.Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy are required.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are required.Excellent organizational skills are required.Ability to analyze and solve problems, work under time pressure and stress, handle multiple projects in parallel, work individually as well as part of a team.Knowledge of solar electric (PV) installation, system design and/or inspection is preferred.Knowledge of mathematical concepts, including graphical representation of data, is preferred.NABCEP certification is a plus.', 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'MGMT, MNFC, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': '', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3971179891/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:39:08.000Z'}

{'title': 'Sr. Applied Scientist', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/6442186', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/amazon-business', 'companyId': '6442186', 'companyUniversalName': 'amazon-business', 'companyName': 'Amazon Business', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 38, 'formattedLocation': 'Palo Alto, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Retail', 'jobDescription': 'Description

Amazon’s product search engine is one of the most heavily used services in the world, indexes billions of products, and serves hundreds of millions of customers world-wide. We are working on an AI-first initiative to further improve the way we do search using large-scale foundation models. These foundation models are also used in downstream applications by various partner teams in Amazon Stores. Our goal is to build large language models (LLMs), which can empower conversational applications and facilitate online shopping. The candidate is expected to develop machine learning (ML) techniques for LLM Alignment and Personalization. This is a rare opportunity to develop cutting edge AI/ML technologies in these areas and apply them to problems of this magnitude.

Basic Qualifications

 PhD in engineering, technology, computer science, machine learning, robotics, operations research, statistics, mathematics or equivalent quantitative field 3+ years of applied research experience Experience with neural deep learning methods and machine learning Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language Knowledge and expertise in Deep Reinforcement Learning (RL) and RL foundations.

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience with RL and dialogue management systems and background in personalization and recommendation systems are desirable. Good background in mathematics and statistics is always a plus.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $136,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $260,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon.com LLC - A03

Job ID: A2574060', 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'RSCH, SCI, ENG', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://www.amazon.jobs/jobs/2574060/sr-applied-scientist?cmpid=SPLICX0248M&utm_source=linkedin.com&utm_campaign=cxro&utm_medium=social_media&utm_content=job_posting&ss=paid', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3877274926/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-06-21T09:33:05.000Z'}

column15:
{'title': 'Senior Data Scientist', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1038', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/deloitte', 'companyId': '1038', 'companyUniversalName': 'deloitte', 'companyName': 'Deloitte', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 1, 'formattedLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': '', 'formattedIndustries': 'Accounting, IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services', 'jobDescription': "Position Summary:

Data Science & Machine Learning is one of the key drivers for Deloitte's successful business growth, and we are fully committed to deliver best class products and solution strategies. This position is for a role on HealthPrism™, a solution designed to provide insights about populations who are at an elevated risk for various health conditions. We are hiring a Senior Data Scientist to lead a team of data scientists in building predictive models to achieve technical delivery objectives and address real-world business challenges. The ideal candidate has direct, hands-on experience in predictive modeling using machine learning techniques and has experience leading a team of data scientists in data wrangling, data visualization, statistical analysis and building predictive, machine learning models using supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised techniques.

Work You'll Do

Understand the business use case, conduct preliminary analysis, and propose potential solutions using statistical and predictive modeling techniques to solve clients' problemsPerform feasibility analysis of proposed solutions through data exploration and building proof of concept predictive modelsLead and train a team of data scientists in building advanced analytical and predictive models using large volumes of structured, semi-structured and chaotic dataConduct research, pull data from disparate data sources and prepare data prior to building models on a variety of use casesApply analytical reasoning to solve challenges such as data imbalance, overfitting, etc. to improve model performanceInvestigate model outcomes using feature importance, SHAP analysis etc. to interpret modelsUpdate your knowledge base with AI/ML advancesWork in a highly collaborative atmosphere of data scientists and team leaders from various geographic locationsPresent model methodology and outcomes to key stakeholders for technical review and feedbackMentor, motivate and coach junior data scientists on technical best practices and inspire professional development

The Team

HealthPrism™ is a population segmentation solution that empowers clients to achieve better health outcomes for the communities they serve by mobilizing cutting-edge AI, social drivers of health data, and geospatial analytics. The team has a proven track record serving its clients to reveal actionable social, economic, health, and lifestyle insights. Check out HealthPrism™ !

Basic Qualifications:

Strong quantitative and analytical skills with a fundamental understanding of Statistical and Machine Learning algorithmsStrong programming skills in Python and SQLStrong problem-solving skills with emphasis on predictive modeling at the individual levelAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyExcellent communication and critical thinking skillsA passion for leading and supporting career growth for a team of data scientists5+ years of strong predictive modeling experience using machine learning techniques2+ years of experience leading a team of data scientists in building predictive models to address challenging business problemsMaster's degree or greater in Engineering/Computer Science/Statistics/Mathematics or other quantitative fieldMust be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred Qualifications:

Strong understanding of algorithmic bias and implicationsExperience with building and deploying models in any cloud servicePhD in Engineering/Computer Science/Statistics/Mathematics or other quantitative field

Information for applicants with a need for accommodation: https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html", 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'ENG, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=92e885957d9cfea399ba23703b14fb89', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3974339101/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:15:42.000Z'}
column16:
{'title': 'Data Scientist - Tooling', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/7602863', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/flyzipline', 'companyId': '7602863', 'companyUniversalName': 'flyzipline', 'companyName': 'Zipline', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 61, 'formattedLocation': 'South San Francisco, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Entry level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage', 'jobDescription': "About Zipline

Do you want to change the world? Zipline is on a mission to transform the way goods move. Our aim is to solve the world’s most urgent and complex access challenges by building, manufacturing and operating the first instant delivery and logistics system that serves all humans equally, wherever they are. From powering Rwanda’s national blood delivery network and Ghana’s COVID-19 vaccine distribution, to providing on-demand home delivery for Walmart, to enabling healthcare providers to bring care directly to U.S. homes, we are transforming the way things move for businesses, governments and consumers. The technology is complex but the idea is simple: a teleportation service that delivers what you need, when you need it. Through our technology that includes robotics and autonomy, we are decarbonizing delivery, decreasing road congestion, and reducing fossil fuel consumption and air pollution, while providing equitable access to billions of people and building a more resilient global supply chain.

Join Zipline and help us to make good on our promise to build an equitable and more resilient global supply chain for billions of people.

About You And The Role

Zipline is hiring a senior data scientist to support analysis of the vast amounts of data produced by our autonomous aircraft and various IoT devices. In this role, you'll lead efforts to develop tools for analyzing and visualizing data produced by hardware devices and use these tools to answer business critical questions. The ideal candidate will be excited about developing high-quality code and user-friendly tools that help team members derive insights from our data. Your work will enable the entire organization to make more informed decisions, innovate faster, and serve our customers better.

What You'll Do

Drive essential improvements towards the user-friendliness and efficiency of our Python libraries for interfacing with Zipline data. Partner with our data engineers to identify opportunities to simplify and speed up data analysis by making upgrades to our data pipelines and data formats. Partner with upstream engineering teams to refine data logging patterns and resolve data quality issues. Spend time with your customers and use their feedback to create a roadmap that you’ll execute against. Carry out analysis on data produced by our hardware systems and create insightful visualizations to share your findings. Create reusable reference notebooks and material that will be leveraged by several teams to carry out high-value analyses. Serve as an internal consultant on our data metrics definitions and actively steer efforts to raise code quality. Document and evangelize the value of our data tools to engineers and other cross-functional partners. 


What You'll Bring 

Advanced proficiency with Python and libraries commonly used for data analysis, e.g., Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, and Matplotlib. Proficiency with data orchestration tools like Prefect or Airflow. Adept at summarizing large datasets visually that make complex results understandable at a glance. Strong understanding of descriptive statistics, probability, and statistical modeling. Experience working with continuous integration and continuous deployment processes and tools. Skilled at translating a general question or problem into clearly defined analysis and presenting actionable insights. Adept at prioritizing critical analysis requests and balancing multiple projects, deadlines, and stakeholders at once.A desire to continuously improve your work and the work of others. Experience listening to customers, identifying opportunities, and creating roadmaps and detailed project plans. Enthusiasm to work closely with engineering teams and develop domain knowledge about hardware and software across the company. Passion and excitement to serve as a technical mentor and thought leader.Nice to haves: Experience with Databricks or PySparkExperience building interactive visualization suitesExperience with AWSExperience with Docker
What Else You Need to Know

The starting cash range for this role is $160,000 - 190,000. Please note that this is a target, starting cash range for a candidate who meets the minimum qualifications for this role. The final cash pay for this role will depend on a variety of factors, including a specific candidate's experience, qualifications, skills, working location, and projected impact. The total compensation package for this role may also include: equity compensation; discretionary annual or performance bonuses; sales incentives; benefits such as medical, dental and vision insurance; paid time off; and more.

Zipline is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws or our own sensibilities.

We value diversity at Zipline and welcome applications from those who are traditionally underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this position but are not sure if you are the perfect fit, please apply!

Please Note

We have received reports stating that certain individuals are reaching out to people under false pretenses, claiming to be Zipline employees, affiliates, agents, or representatives. They may seek to gain access to your personal information or to acquire money from you by offering fictitious employment opportunities or by claiming that they are contacting you on Zipline’s behalf.

Genuine Zipline employees or representatives will never ask you for money or payment in exchange for employment opportunities or other related services. Any such offer of employment or any other service in exchange for fees that claims to be from us is deceitful and part of a fraud.

If you believe you have been targeted by a fraudulent party, we ask that you immediately get in touch with us via email at security@flyzipline.com upon receiving a suspicious offer or claim.", 'inferredBenefits': 'Vision insurance', 'jobFunctions': 'ENG, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://www.flyzipline.com/careers/open-roles?gh_jid=5507777003', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3969287242/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-08T23:50:27.000Z'}
column17:
{'title': 'Data Scientist, Junior with Security Clearance', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1007957', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/clearancejobs', 'companyId': '1007957', 'companyUniversalName': 'clearancejobs', 'companyName': 'ClearanceJobs', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': 1, 'formattedLocation': 'San Diego, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Part-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Entry level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Defense and Space Manufacturing', 'jobDescription': "Job Number: R0201456 Data Scientist, Junior

The Opportunity: As a data scientist, you're excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you're fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, machine learning, and artifi cia l intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data scientist at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors-from fraud detection to cancer research to national intelligence-we need you to help find the answers in the data. On our team, you'll use your analytical skills to help create real-world impact. You'll work closely with clients to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You'll work with and learn from your teammates as you develop algorithms and systems. You'll use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers so that your clients can make informed decisions. Ultimately, you'll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used. Work with us as we use data science for good. Join us. The world can't wait. You Have: * Experience with data exploration, data cleaning, data analysis, data visualization, or data mining * Experience with statistical and general-purpose programming languages for data analysis * Knowledge of structured and unstructured data sources * Knowledge of Machine Learning, Artifi cia l Intelligence, or Natural Language Processing * Ability to develop predictive data models, quantitative analyses, and visualization of targeted data sources * Ability to deploy natural language processing, text mining, or machine learning te chn iques * Ability to obtain a security clearance * Bachelor's degree Nice If You Have: * Experience in the development of algorithms leveraging R, Python, or SQL and NoSQL * Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, EMR, Kafka, Spark, Gurobi, or MySQL * Experience with visualization packages, including Plotly, Seaborn, or ggplot2 * Secret clearance * Master's degree Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information . Create Your Career: Grow With Us Your growth matters to us-that's why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs , tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms. A Place Where You Belong Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen's culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you'll develop your community in no time. Support Your Well-Being Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401 ( k ) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we'll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life-at work and at home. Your Candidate Journey At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we've compiled a list of resources so you'll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us. Compensation At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen's benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page. Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $60,300.00 to $137,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen's total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date. Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely. * If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you'll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.

 If this position is listed as onsite, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role. EEO Commitment We're an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change - no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.", 'inferredBenefits': '401(k), Tuition assistance', 'jobFunctions': 'ENG, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://click.appcast.io/track/k1ty111?cs=i8d&jg=4nq9&bid=q948nGl57dNhZO5Va2AQmA==', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3973678165/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:30:35.000Z'}

{'title': 'Manager 1 QuickBooks Live Service Delivery', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/1666', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/intuit', 'companyId': '1666', 'companyUniversalName': 'intuit', 'companyName': 'Intuit', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': '', 'formattedLocation': 'Mountain View, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': "Overview

Join Intuit’s Service Delivery Team in our QuickBooks Live Expert Assisted offering. With a special focus on supporting Small Business owners with professional bookkeeper and accountant assistance, you will help create an environment that will allow our Quickbooks Live Experts to do the best work of their lives. You will be providing leadership and performance management to a team of front line accounting industry professionals, who provide guidance to Small Business owners that are self-managing their books. We are looking for strong leaders who are excited about helping grow and improve this new service.

Ideal candidates will have 5+ years accounting experience, experience managing a high performing remote and geographically diverse team, and exceptional change management skills.

What you'll bring

One (or More) Of The Following

Active CPA credential (Certified Public Accountant),Active CPB credential (Certified Public Bookkeeper),5 or more years of recent experience managing books for Small Business Clients,orReceived a 4-year business degree in Accounting/Finance

And

Active QuickBooks ProAdvisor certification (at start date) Minimum of one year experience working with QuickBooks Online Effectively manage a remote workforce, taking into account and understanding the unique needs of this community.Proficient with technology; solid knowledge of computer operations and softwareExperience working with team members in establishing career development plans and in meeting individual needsStrong customer service skills- ability to interact with customers through video and audio tools in a way that is professional, friendly, and reassuringStrong teamwork skills, flexibility, and a positive attitudeAbility to quickly and creatively adapt to changing situations, while proactively developing solutionsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervisionCritical thinking, problem-solving, and determinationMust be willing to have a background and credit check before being considered for this roleBilingual a plus

How you will lead

Lead the team through a fast-paced, constantly changing environmentDeliver the highest quality support to QuickBooks Live Expert Assisted customers by hiring, training, and performance management of talented Bookkeeping ProfessionalsCreate a high-performing team that champions innovation and continuous improvement.Foster a collaborative and positive team environment with a focus on both customer and expert experiences.Effectively use data to evaluate, identify, and coach performance to our core KPIs’ of tNPS, IR, AHT, and PRS.Drive quality customer engagements by monitoring your team’s performance, providing actionable feedback, implementing improvement plans, and measuring progress toward goals.Provide growth and development opportunities through the use of employee one-on-one sessions, team op mechs, and ongoing learning sessionsEnsure the team is aligned with Intuit’s Mission, Operating Values, and Goals.Act as the conduit between the team and the business by condensing and disseminating large amounts of information", 'inferredBenefits': '', 'jobFunctions': 'PRJM, IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://dsp.prng.co/ICeslZb', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3974365093/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:56:24.000Z'}

{'title': 'Sr. Oracle Database Administrator', 'comapnyURL1': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/6849', 'comapnyURL2': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/dice', 'companyId': '6849', 'companyUniversalName': 'dice', 'companyName': 'Dice', 'salaryInsights': '', 'applicants': '', 'formattedLocation': 'Torrance, CA', 'formattedEmploymentStatus': 'Full-time', 'formattedExperienceLevel': 'Mid-Senior level', 'formattedIndustries': 'Software Development', 'jobDescription': 'Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Calance, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

** The FASTEST way to be considered for this role is to CALL US - simply hit "Apply On Web" or "Apply Now", where you will be re-directed to our website to view our Recruiter's contact phone details **

** We will NOT accept 3rd Party (C2C) Contractors **

Position:Sr. Oracle Database Administrator

JOB REF#:42539 - JIH5JP00003027

Duration:12+ Months (On-Going Contract)

Location:HYBRID - Torrance, CA 90501

Pay Rate:$74.00 per hour (W2 Only)

HYBRID: MUST be able to work ONSITE 2 day a week (LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY)

Sr. Oracle Database Administrator, this person will be working closely with application teams for implementing project specific tasks, maintain existing databases and perform daily/weekly/monthly/yearly tasks.

Responsibilities include:

Supporting DR activities

Collaborate with data architects, developers and stakeholders to design data models (CDM, LDM, PDM) and implement, database schemas, tables, indexes, and relationships.

Create / Modify Data Models using Data Modeling tools.

Project Development Support

Tuning, Monitoring and Patching

Inter/Intra Organizational Communication

Backup and Recovery

Security and Compliance of the Oracle database environment

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

7+ years of Oracle Database Administrator experience

2+ years of experience in working large scale projects.

Must have knowledge of Cloud computing concepts, virtualization, and Infrastructure-As-A-Service (IaaS) platforms.

Must have RAC clustering knowledge.

1+ years of experience in SOX related requests.

Strong technical knowledge of Oracle database administration, architecture/design, data analysis and management

Strong technical knowledge of current Oracle database systems and versions, including other DB tools (Toad), utilities and active directory

Extensive application support experience working with application teams

High-level understanding of IT infrastructure planning and development.

Excellent understanding of the organization s goals and objectives.

In-depth knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.

Good understanding of Project Management skills.

DESIRED SKILLS:

Experience in Automotive IT industry

Calance Consultant Benefits Offerings:

 EPO/PPO Medical Plan (Cigna) HMO/PPO Dental programs (Cigna) Vision - VSP (Vision Plan Summary) 401K VOYA Retirement vesting program Paid Bi-Weekly/Direct Deposit', 'inferredBenefits': '401(k)', 'jobFunctions': 'IT', 'companyApplyUrl': 'https://click.appcast.io/track/k1zinz6?cs=ivj&sjg=8cgz', 'jobPostingUrl': 'https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3971175325/?trk=jobs_biz_prem_srch', 'listedAt': '2024-07-12T15:28:08.000Z'}
